text:
For over 14 years, AWS has been a cloud leader
helping enterprises improve agility, strengthen

security, and reduce cost by moving workloads to
the cloud. As more and more companies

recognize the importance of a distributed
workforce, there remains a significant amount of

data stored on on-premises file servers and
specialized network attached storage appliances.

Expanding on-premises NAS consumes time,
capital, and hardware. Moving this data into AWS

enables you to access native AWS services to
accelerate digital transformation and reduce costs.

Unstructured data is everywhere – documents,
social media feeds, digital pictures, videos, IoT

sensor data, and more. This data is commonly
stored as files on a file system. Organizations are

moving to managed cloud file storage to simply
and easily integrate without changes to code,

provide equivalent and upgraded features and
functionality compared to on-premises solutions,

and offer flexible deployment options to optimize
price and performance. AWS offers high

performance, reliable storage for a broad range of
workloads including high performance databases

and enterprise applications. With your file storage
that runs industry standard SMB and NFS

protocols, you can leverage AWS file storage
services like Amazon FSx and Amazon EFS in the

cloud to improve agility and TCO, enhance
availability and performance, strengthen your

security posture, and create faster time-to-market.
You can benefit from a range of cloud storage

solutions to easily move to managed file storage
without making changes to your existing

applications or workflows. Some of the key use
cases for moving to managed file storage with

AWS include: SMB File Shares – Amazon FSx for
Windows File Server provides a fully managed

SMB file service and is the industry's lowest cost
file storage in the cloud for Windows workloads,

allowing you to significantly reduce operational
overhead. NFS File Systems – Amazon EFS

provides a fully managed, scalable, highly
available, secure, and durable NFS storage for

Linux and persistent file storage for containers
and serverless. Hybrid File Storage - AWS hybrid

cloud storage architectures connect your
on-premises applications and systems to cloud file

storage to help you reduce costs, minimize
management burden, and innovate with your data.

AWS provides a portfolio of data transfer services
to help you migrate data from on-premises to the

cloud. The level of connectivity is a major factor in
data migration and we have offerings that can

address your online data transfer needs using
AWS DataSync, hybrid cloud storage needs using

AWS Storage Gateway, and offline data transfer
challenges using the AWS Snow Family of

services. A recent IDC business value survey
reported that moving applications to AWS

improves efficiency, while lowering long-term
costs. The survey indicated 51% lower 5-year cost

of operations, 62% more efficient IT infrastructure
staff, and 90% less staff time to deploy new

storage. The AWS Cloud is built to deliver flexible,
reliable, scalable, and secure infrastructure. Move

your on-premises file data to fully managed cloud
file storage today to start maximizing your data.
